tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: A Country Road: The Nationals
programme.desc: A rollicking political history, presented by Heather Ewart. Episode 2 focuses on the disastrous Joh for PM campaign which destroyed the Federal Coalition and almost brought down the party.

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Stews are great for weekends; the preparation is minimal and they more or less look after themselves when you have other things to do. Nigella shares one of her favourites, Greek lamb stew with pasta. (Final)

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Death In Paradise: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Christmas festivities take a back seat when a podcaster is murdered whilst investigating the disappearance of a child. Its a case thats haunted Selwyn for many years, and now Neville and the team must lay its ghost to rest.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the murder of an estate agent during the private sale of a picturesque beach and discover the buyers were victims of a scam. Meanwhile, Marlon leads a counterfeit goods case to impress the Commissioner.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Battle of the Networks
programme.desc: Its the Battle of the Networks as TV titans Larry Emdur, Leigh Sales, Angela Bishop and Karl Stefanovic step up to the podiums to defend their home channels honour. Will Tom out-host them all? Its must-see TV!

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: On a steep site in the wilds of Mahurangi, just north of Auckland, architect Felicity Brenchly is prepared to do whatever it takes to get her family home built.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Jerry Coleby-Williams meets a champion hibiscus grower, Costa Georgiadis starts his backyard pool to pond conversion, Jane Edmanson shows us how to propagate indoor plants and we explore the wonderful world of fungi.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: The Piano UK
programme.desc: A chance to watch the full final concert from the Royal Festival Hall, featuring performances by Lang Lang, Mika and the four finalists. (Final)

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team join Naomi in Saint Barnabas when her best friends father is murdered at a wedding. Meanwhile, Marlon tries to prepare for his sergeant exams but is easily distracted.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Mario Wonder Hands-on and Noob Cops Part 4
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, we get our hands on a special preview of Super Mario Bros. Wonder, plus the Noob Cops continue their investigations and find someone close to them may be hiding some big secrets!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Rosemary Riddle
programme.desc: Ezra is grumpy when his visiting Nanna interrupts his detective work until she unexpectedly gives the Inbestigators a case to crack.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Worried that Miss Grayling has called the police after stealing from Matrons safe, Jo and Connie are too afraid to own up and go on the run. Fred attempts to help them escape, but its not long before Darrell catches up.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Shaggy and Scoobys favourite chef is finally opening his own restaurant but a monstrous Yeti threatens the opening night.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: After getting sucked into Jareds favorite board game, Buttercup is forced to team-up with him in order to save her sisters.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun decides he wants to have a go at skateboarding and sets about building a skatepark from scrap he finds in the dump. Before too long he gets carried away and suddenly discovers its a bit riskier than he first thought.

programme.title: How To Train Your Dragon: Homecoming
programme.desc: When it becomes clear that the new generation of Vikings doesnt remember the bond between dragon and human, Hiccup sets a plan to celebrate dragons with a grand Snoggletog holiday pageant.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Have the Bears lost their survival instincts by living in the modern world? Grizz wants to know, so he purposefully gets the Bears lost in the deep forest.

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Jessica pushes the family to settle all debts, disputes and grudges to ensure good fortune for the Lunar New Year. Louis and Evan hunt down some hate mail, and Eddie is forced to entertain his super lame cousin.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, we dig into the Dungeons and Dragons expansion for Minecraft, plus the mastermind behind the recent spate of Noob Crimes is finally unmasked in Noob Cops!

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going as the sun comes up with continuous music videos, from new releases to classics and the songs weve long forgotten.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Spoiled Sports Day
programme.desc: At the sports carnival, Kyle loses his temper when he doesnt win a race, but Maudie suspects there might be more to Kyles unexpected loss.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Shaggy and Scooby meet Jim Gaffigan in an eating competition.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Blossom goes up against Morbucks for President.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is playing the piano and torturing everyone with his musical inability! When the Flock discover that Bitzer is a virtuoso they decide its time for a party. They devise a plan to borrow the piano from the Farmer.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors take a dip in the sea to reveal how your sensory neurons detect when something is hot or cold, and they find themselves getting stuck in the mud when they join Her Majestys Coastguard in Operation Takeover.

programme.title: The Wonderful World Of Puppies
programme.desc: Some very special puppies enter a new phase of their lives - as they leave their littermates and join their new human families. Watch as they form bonds that last a lifetime and become mans best friend!

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig takes some time to reflect as she asks Alan Davies, Joe Lycett, Zoe Lyons and Liza Tarbuck some impossible and interesting questions.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Cleo wonders whether the right team is going to the nationals, and Richelle is brought to breaking point by someone she hoped to never see again.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Moomintroll employs the services of his new friend, a little ghost, to convince Snork Maiden that he is brave. But when his trick backfires dangerously, Moomintroll is the one who needs saving.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is preparing for a date! He wants to look his best so its time to dust off his prized hairpiece. Shaun cant resist trying the wig on but loses it while showing off to the flock.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.sub-title: The Truth The Pole Truth And Nothing But The Truth
programme.desc: If spending the day balancing on a pole under the direct sun with no food in your tummy sounds like a fun time you are going to love todays challenge.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: When they realize theyre too small for the rides at an amusment park, the Bears use a magic potion to get bigger.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: A toy trade between Steven and Onion escalates into epic proportions.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Martin and Yvonne Davies family home hasnt found a buyer in 18 months. Phil promises that with some hard graft he can shift their pad. But nobody will be working harder than daughter Emily who has monopolised four bedrooms.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: Florences undercover role takes a dangerous turn when she finds herself in familiar surroundings, amid a murder investigation. In a race against time, can Neville solve the murder?

programme.title: rage Vault: Director Nick Launay
programme.desc: From The Slits to Talking Heads, Even, Killing Heidi, Midnight Oil and more, rage lines up clips of songs produced by legendary English record producer and composer Nick Launay.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Comedian David Baddiel, comedian Cariad Lloyd and stand-up comedian Ross Noble join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate questions and facts on the theme nature and nurture.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker take an entertaining, off-beat look at the weeks big stories and answer your #IsItOk questions. With special guests Lorraine Kelly and Miles Jupp.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Talented and hungry dancers show up for the challenge which may shake up The Next Step.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: The Moomin familys attempts to help a very shy girl only make things worse. Can Moomintroll learn to listen long enough to understand what she really needs?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The sheep discover a set of bagpipes on the rubbish dump, which they immediately misidentify as a sick emu. They set about trying to nurse it back to health before releasing it back into the wild.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: With just 5 campers remaining things are getting tense. So today is just about having fun taking selfies with wild animals. Everyone had their rabies shot?

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: The Bears meet three cool tiger brothers. Grizz wants to be just like the oldest Tiger, TK, but he may not be the best role model

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven and Connie try to ride Lion to the movie theatre, but Lion has other ideas.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie turn dirigible detectives to try and solve one of aeronautics biggest puzzles. Plus Kari, Tory and Grant come face-to-face, and have to flee from some of Natures natural-born killers.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Laura Dayachandra wants to downsize but despite having dozens of buyers through, she cant seal the deal. There are rooms in disrepair and the dining room doesnt exist - but Phils convinced they can turn the house around.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The younglings track an escaped creature.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The Twins really want a pet, so Nanny Plum sets out to get them one. She magics them up Pippin the hamster. The Wise Old Elf brings Pippin a hamster wheel, but Pippin runs too fast in it and breaks out of the castle.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a waiter set a wedding table in a marquee. He places plates and cutlery next to each other. The team then decide to help out.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel is excited to go on a boat ride, but rushes and breaks his toy boat. Grandpere shows him that its good to go slow.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig reads Peppa and George a bedtime story to help them fall asleep. When George wakes up again Peppa has to make up a bedtime story to get him back to sleep.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Drainpipe Dan is on the loose stealing Mrs Browns wedding ring. Inspector Paddington of the yard is on his trail.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben, Holly and their friends go on a snail trek with Miss Jolly. The trek goes well until the snails head straight toward the Elf Farm and Mr Elfs cabbages...

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Driving along in Mummy Sheeps car, they spot an old van at the Recycling Centre. With the help of Peppas friends, they make the van colourful!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Pounce falls in the lagoon and gets covered in seaweed, the other cadets mistake him for a swamp monster, and decide they have to capture it.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When Twig steals Cosimas volleyball, a chase leads Big Lizard and Cosima to her den, and a happy discovery!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Zindzi and Leah make a colourful, twinkling rangoli and whip up some shaky, spicy eggs! We learn about an Italian tradition, Passata Day, and Through The Windows we see a family celebrating Diwali, the festival of lights!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups take a holiday from tidying up, only to find that mess has a strange habit of following them wherever they go. Will the Mixmups find "another way" to have a tidy holiday?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing drives his toy car around the breakfast things on the table and accidentally spills krispos all over the kitchen floor.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo teach Unicorse good manners so he can ask Mum on a date, but things go sideways when Unicorse eats a tick.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Mister Maker, Scrappz and Tocky find out how to make something prehistoric in South America. In Australia, discover if Mister Maker can make a gorgeous glitter badge. And see whats cooking in a Hong Kong street market.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When a gull builds a nest on Cranky, he refuses to unload Bulstrodes deliveries until the egg hatches, so Thomas and his friends roll in to get the job done!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Mr Potatos Fruit And Vegetable Quiz
programme.desc: Mr Potato visits the school to sing the vegetable song and tell the children about the importance of eating five fruits or vegetables a day. But which team will win his quiz?

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes guide a young Strawberrisaurus to find the courage to perform a special friendship dance that will help them find a lifelong playmate.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: The family are going camping but Tish doesnt want to get her new shoes muddy, which will be difficult when Rosa and Pola tell Tish to look after Bobby.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When Moose is too scared to sleep out in the woods with the rest of the Nature Guide Troupe the Crew uses materials they find in nature to build a "roughing-it" doghouse, to help Moose feel more comfortable.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Giant Kelp Forest
programme.desc: When Kwaziis favourite sub, the Gup-B goes missing, the Octonauts journey into a mysterious kelp forest to find it, meeting strange and interesting creatures along the way.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are playing in the treehouse when they stumble upon a room full of old radio equipment, and discover that Duggee used to host his own show!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy and Sarah try to get the big scoop on who the special guest performing at the Big Pontypandy Festival will be!

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Teo and Alex are joined by special guest Eddie in The Make and Create Studio where they use a machine to transform recycling! Teo and Alex upcycle everyday objects in the garden, and Maurice hosts an upcycled fashion show!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George join Granny Pig and her friends to play at being Vikings. The Vikings are having fun on Grandpa Pigs boat until they realise theyve left their picnic behind!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.sub-title: The Day Ammon Overcame Her Fear
programme.desc: If Ammon gets spooked by a tiny insect, how can she summon the bravery to rescue Cosima and Big Lizard from the river rapids?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When multiple emergencies break out on a windy day at Kangaroo Beach, Neville offer help as an assistant medic. Meanwhile, Pounce learns how to kite surf.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Owlette causes a freak asteroid accident and Gekko and Catboy try to help her put it right. But there is more to the accident than there seems when the PJ Masks meet another night-time hero in space, introducing Newton.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When the Squirrels find Duggee playing saxophone, they want to have a go too. The squirrels make their own musical instruments, playing pots, balloons, tins, water and tubes, but boy are they loud!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: While hunting for the legendary Lost Candle of Birthdays, Supertato and Tomato are lured into Evil Peas Cake of Iced Doom.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nashs Jedi friends help reunite her favourite band.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: After seeing a toy Elf rocket, the King orders a real rocket to fly to the moon. Elf honour is at stake and the Elves make a rocket in record time. For the trip, Nanny packs a picnic.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos see an artist drawing a dog and decide to open and close the door to let the dog in and out of the room.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Katerina bakes mozies with Jodi, but rushes and forgets to add the oats. They slow down and make yummy mozies.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family have been on a trip to a mountain beauty spot. When Daddy Pig loses the car keys down a drain Mr Bull offers to find them with his digger...

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Its a perfect, windy day and Jonathan wishes to play kite with his dad. Mr Brown is stuck at home doing business, so Paddington takes Jonathan to the park to play kites.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Springtime in the Little Kingdom brings out tulips, daffodils, hedgehogs...and two very hungry gnomes. Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf come up with a plan to stop the gnomes from eating everything in sight.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and friends along with Mummy sheep and Granny Sheep are taking Vanessa to Grampy Rabbits boat yard to be inspired. The children make all sorts of creations from things lying around!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its the day of the big Kangaroo Beach beach cricket match, but when Gemma and the cadets find a nest of turtle eggs, they play parents, vowing to protect the eggs from seagulls, crabs and flying cricket balls.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizards solar-powered hoverboards run out of battery as night falls. Some troublesome glowbugs are attracted to Big Lizards dinner and manage to save the day!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Hunter and Kaeng make delicious damper to eat as they sing around the campfire with special guest Gregg Dreise. We visit a festival celebrating NAIDOC week and Through The Windows, we watch a fun game of footy!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: Pockets has a wonderful dream but soon after she wakes, shes forgotten it. Will the Mixmups find "another way" to catch a dream and keep it forever?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. Its got climbing bits, tippy bits and even wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide its too scary for him to go down.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo finds a toy turtle at the playground and wants to take him home, but Dad says its not the done thing.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In South Africa Mister Maker creates a sensational shark picture, in Australia, we find out if he can make a marble creature and in the UK theres a great way of creating colourful works of art from pieces of fruit.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Thomas and Diesel get stuck in a snowstorm while making important deliveries and have to improvise train versions of winter sports to escape the blizzard and make it to Sodors Winter Games.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today at playgroup Peppa and her friends make their own instruments from bits and bobs of old packaging.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When a young Watermelonsuchus gets beached during a heatwave, Ginger and the Baby Pea Rexes have to get creative to work out a way to get the giant baby into the water.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish is struggling to eat with a wobbly tooth. Tash suggests they shrink themselves down to check out the tooth in person.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Upon learning about a Scott family tall tale about their twin ancestors daring adventures, Drew and Jonathan build a pirate ship, only to set sail through town and learn what it really means to be a "Pirate Scott".

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Great Algae Escape
programme.desc: Captain Barnacles and crew must catch a runaway Octopod, when its hijacked by a group of crustaceans trying to escape their algae-infested waters.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has his Opposites Badge, and helps the squirrels understand that an opposite is something that is exactly different to another thing, by using lots of fun examples.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Professor Pickles attempts to create an EPIC historical walking trail, but he creates emergency of EPIC proportions instead!

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Rachael and Teo get creative making swirly whirly marbling patterns on paper and fabric. They create a paper puppet world, and Teo uses the marbled fabric to make a fun hat to twist and shake in!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Charlotte Sheep is babysitting her cousin Suzy Sheep and her best friend Peppa. Peppa and Suzy are excited at their sleepover and sit up in bed talking about what they will do when they are all grown up.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard and Cosima undertake an exciting nighttime mission rehoming a friendly slug thats taken residence in Cosimas bedroom!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets host a do something new for you day on Kangaroo Beach in an effort to help support Pounce while he learns a tricky new skill.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton likes the PJ Masks... but also likes his solitude.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When Egg, the cheeky little chick goes on the run again Duggee whistles to get him back. Hang on a minute Duggee, what was that noise? A whistle? The squirrels want to learn how to whistle.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato is having a sleepover at Tato Tower for all his friends, even Evil Pea.

programme.title: A Country Road: The Nationals
programme.desc: A rollicking political history, presented by Heather Ewart. Episode 2 focuses on the disastrous Joh for PM campaign which destroyed the Federal Coalition and almost brought down the party.

programme.desc: Stews are great for weekends; the preparation is minimal and they more or less look after themselves when you have other things to do. Nigella shares one of her favourites, Greek lamb stew with pasta. (Final)

programme.desc: A chance to watch the full final concert from the Royal Festival Hall, featuring performances by Lang Lang, Mika and the four finalists. (Final)

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team join Naomi in Saint Barnabas when her best friends father is murdered at a wedding. Meanwhile, Marlon tries to prepare for his sergeant exams but is easily distracted.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Craig Smart brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Craig Smart in Perth.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.sub-title: The Untold Story: China in the Pacific
programme.desc: Beyond the headlines of power struggles and politics we uncover the story of China in the Pacific. We hear directly from Chinese communities and Pacific Islanders about identity, belonging and the tensions shaping the future.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Craig Smart in Perth.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Culture By Design
programme.desc: How can design help us live more sustainably? Learn how environmentally-focused architects and furniture designers in Delhi, India and Jakarta, Indonesia, are creating groundbreaking and impactful designs.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Ros Childs brings you latest on the days top stories including tributes and investigations in the wake of the Bondi Beach Terror Attack, the Treasurer delivers the midyear economic update, plus Day 1 of the Third Ashes Test.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: Ros Childs brings you latest on the days top stories including tributes and investigations in the wake of the Bondi Beach Terror Attack, the Treasurer delivers the midyear economic update, plus Day 1 of the Third Ashes Test.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you latest on the days top stories including tributes and investigations in the wake of the Bondi Beach Terror Attack, the Treasurer delivers the midyear economic update plus Day 1 of the Third Ashes Test.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.sub-title: Heartfelt - Col Clausen And Laura Aisbett
programme.desc: When Col and Laura met, they were both grieving the sudden death of a cherished spouse. They soon had to confront a thorny question - when is an appropriate time is to find love after loss?

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you latest on the days top stories including tributes and investigations in the wake of the Bondi Beach Terror Attack, the Treasurer delivers the midyear economic update plus Day 1 of the Third Ashes Test.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Michael Tetlow brings you the days top stories including the latest following the Bondi Beach Terror Attack, the Treasurer delivers the midyear economic update plus Day 1 of the Third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Spies In The Outback
programme.desc: The terror attacks of 9/11 change the world and cement Pine Gaps role in wars on the other side of the world. In the final episode, we hear just how far Pine Gaps reach is today and uncover the secrets of its stolen land.

programme.title: Whitlam Dismissal: 50 Years
programme.desc: The dismissal of an elected Australian Government has only happened once. 50 years ago Sir John Kerr sensationally sacked PM Gough Whitlam. Greg Jennett looks at the legacy of the historic event and how it shaped democracy.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, plus Emma Rebellato with sport and Nate Byrne with weather.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.
Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: On the brink of death in India, Bharat Sundaresan turned to cricket, gathering millions of followers. But its now in Australia that the colourful commentator has found true acceptance.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.
